summary: This is an email chain from March 2, 2021, between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel and Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney, Bobbi C. Sternheim, discussing Maxwell's unusual bail application. The chain includes a forwarded message from February 23, 2021, where Sternheim provides a courtesy copy of the bail filing, and a prosecutor reacts with disbelief to its contents.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Sternheim
persons.context: She is the attorney filing Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application and sending a courtesy copy to the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: He is cc'd on the email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the bail application filing.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: She is cc'd on the email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the bail application filing.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: He is cc'd on the email from Bobbi Sternheim regarding the bail application filing.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: She is the subject of the criminal case (U.S. v. Maxwell) and the defendant whose bail application is being discussed.

connections.description: Sternheim is acting as defense counsel for Maxwell, as evidenced by her filing the bail application on Maxwell's behalf.
Both are part of Maxwell's defense team, as Everdell is cc'd on Sternheim's filing notification.

events.title: Filing of Maxwell's Bail Application
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, led by Bobbi C. Sternheim, files a bail application in her criminal case, which is described as containing an 'unusual' financial proposal.

events.title: Prosecution Discussion of Bail Proposal
events.description: A prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York seeks to discuss Maxwell's unusual bail proposal before drafting a formal response.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team filed a bail application on February 23, 2021, which proposed an unusual financial condition for her release.
A prosecutor from the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) reacted to the bail proposal with the comment 'Unbelievable' on February 23, 2021.
On March 2, 2021, a prosecutor sought to discuss the unusual bail proposal with colleagues before drafting the government's formal response.
Maxwell's defense team at this time included attorneys Bobbi C. Sternheim, Christian Everdell, Laura Menninger, and Jeff Pagliuca.
The document is an internal email chain among prosecutors, showing their coordination and reaction to defense filings.
